qas.question: What do the membership of the committees reflect?

answers.text: the balance of parties across Parliament

qas.question: Different committees have what set out in different ways?
What type of committee is set down under the SP's standing orders?
What session is the Scottish Parliament in?
What compromises a large number of MSPs?
What group's membership does not reflect the balance of parties in Parliament?
Optional Committees are committees which are set down under what?
Mandatory Committees exists in the fifth session of what?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>Committees<b6_0/><b5_0/> comprise <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>a small number of MSPs<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, with membership reflecting <a1_2>the <a1_0><a1_1>balance of parties<a1_0/> across Parliament<a1_2/><a1_1/>. There are different committees with <a2_1><a2_2>their <a2_0>functions<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> set out in different ways. <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>Mandatory<a3_1/><a3_0/> Committees<a3_2/> are committees which are set down under the <b7_0>Scottish Parliament's standing orders<b7_0/>, which govern their remits and proceedings. The current Mandatory Committees in <a4_2>the <a4_0><a4_1>fourth<a4_1/><a4_0/> Session<a4_2/> of <b8_0>the Scottish Parliament<b8_0/> are: Public Audit; Equal Opportunities; European and External Relations; Finance; Public Petitions; Standards, Procedures and Public Appointments; and Delegated Powers and Law Reform.
